newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Analysts view on Brazil high court telecom ruling.
newsitem.headline: Analysts view on Brazil high court telecom ruling.

text.p: The following are analysts' reactions to Brazil's High Court ruling that confirms the Communications Ministry can temporarily function as the telecom industry's regulating agency.

JOAO MIYASHIRO, telecom analyst at Unibanco: "This is good news, principally because the court's decision was unanimous. The message here is that the Supreme Court will probably vote in favor of the constitutionality of the Band B tender and the risk that the tender will be delayed is reduced substantially. This will be boosting the stock market tomorrow."
SERGIO MISSIMA, telecom analyst Fator Securities: "This is positive because they ruled in favor of the government. It means they are not going to impede the sell-off of Band B concessions."
Missima said the court's ruling tonight was generally positive for the market, although investors would continue to wait for a definitive ruling.

A senior telecom analyst at a Brazilian investment bank, who asked not to be identified, said today's ruling was a strong sign the court would not interrupt the Band B cellular phone concessions tender scheduled to take place April 7.
"This is positive. But I don't think it will have much impact on the market because the court's ruling was widely expected and so it should already factored into the Telebras price," he said.
